channel.title: [URGENT] Is there a client that runs on MAC OSX 10.3.9?
channel.description: Yeah i kinda need to know if theres a client that runs on panther 10.3.9... don't flame me saying mac is shit, i know it is..this isn't my mac. (its a iMac G3 600MHz with 512mb ram) so yeah. thankss

item.title: [URGENT] Is there a client that runs on MAC OSX 10.3.9?
item.dc:creator: @vamp256 vamp256
item.description:
@vamp256 wrote:

[quote=“xD3ad, post:4, topic:348042”]Obviously running from .jar files are wayyyy easier. But if you want to, go ahead.
and, how do you make clients “.bat” to “.jar”? ;o[/quote]
You need JarMaker, then you have to do inputs loaction output, etc.

@Joker, you can just “save it” as a .jar, you gotta compilie it all into the one file

item.title: [URGENT] Is there a client that runs on MAC OSX 10.3.9?
item.dc:creator: @vamp256 vamp256
item.description:
@vamp256 wrote:

I’ve tried opening terminal millions of times, but it never shows up. I heard rumours that Java doesn’t work properly on 10.3.9(Panther)…should i just upgrade to Tiger for working java, to run from jar files? I have made like 3 jars for the one client but it says the application cant be launched…check console for errors…idk…I’m more of a windows person

Read full topic
item.source: [URGENT] Is there a client that runs on MAC OSX 10.3.9?

item.title: [URGENT] Is there a client that runs on MAC OSX 10.3.9?
item.dc:creator: @xD3ad xD3ad
item.description:
@xD3ad wrote:

Hey there. im a mac user but currently on my windows.
First you’re going to need ;

  1. Terminal
  2. the client files
  3. version of the client.

open up terminal and type cd followed by a space.
Then open up your client files, open it until you reach the files like (egui).
Now go back one step ( meaning you’re at the file before you entered that folder ) and drag that folder which contains the maps, .dats, etc to the terminal. Now hit enter.

/System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/1.6.0/Home/bin/ (add this into your terminal) and then open up your run.bat or whatever.
Then copy and paste the thing that starts from “java” till the end. (dont copy the “exit” or whatever it says at the end.)

Then your client shall popup.
And you shall be able to play.

Read full topic
